text.name: sys_info
text.text: Dunhuang Technology Home video game console Fourth 1995 Cartridge 8 button gamepad

text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Super A'Can is a console released in 1995 exclusively in Taiwan and designed by Dunhuang Technology. At first glance it seems to be a clone of the American version of the Super Nintendo, but it incorporates a Motorola 68000 processor at 10.74 Mhz like the Mega Drive or the Neo-Geo and can display 32768 colors. There are only 12 games compatible with the console because it was a commercial failure. It was too expensive when it was released and was quickly competed by the Playstation. The designers also had to develop the games as quickly as possible, which are of poor quality.
